S2M-3846 Eleanor Scott: Legislate for Better Health—That the Parliament agrees with Dr Peter Terry, chairman of the British Medical Association in Scotland, that a long-term public health strategy can be effective only if there is a co-ordinated approach across all ministerial portfolios; notes that decisions taken in other policy areas have a significant bearing on public health; agrees on the need to develop synergistic policies and cross-departmental co-operation, and calls on the Scottish Executive to introduce a system of routine health impact assessments to be applied to all policies and legislation. R Supported by: Mark Ballard, Patrick Harvie, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Tommy Sheridan*, Carolyn Leckie*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, Robin Harper*, Shiona Baird*
